clues.text: In the 1930s the engineers of the Bay Bridge linking these 2 cities sank supports hundreds of feet to reach the bedrock
Messner & Habeler proved to the world in 1978 that they could climb Mount Everest without supplemental this
Muhammad's booty from the Battle of Badr, Dhu al-Faqar was a magical 2-bladed type of this deadly weapon
In 1943 Norwegian commandos set back the Nazi atom program by destroying a 4-month supply of this liquid
Floyd Bennett won a Medal of Honor for piloting himself & this explorer over the North Pole in 1926
In some areas of Donegal County's west coast, this Irish tongue is the spoken first language, not English
Each July pilgrims climb Ireland's holy mountain Croagh Patrick, in this county that sounds like a sandwich spread
From Piccadilly & Leicester square, "it's a long way to" this largest inland Irish county
This largest Irish county in area is home to Doneraile National Park & Blarney Castle
The lakes of Killarney & Dingle Peninsula make this SW county one of Ireland's most popular tourist destinations
To describe how you move objects between icons on a desktop, this word is paired with "drop"
If we're talking NiCads, we're talking about these in laptops
OS can stand for operating system or this movement to make operating systems & other programs freely available
Actors might memorize these rectangles that appear onscreen to present information, then vanish
The "RW" in DVD-RW is for this adjective, meaning users can erase what's on the DVD & put new stuff on it

rounds.comments: (Alex: We'll give you the [*]; you name the birth country.)

clues.text: Golf's Ernie Els
Baseball's Yasiel Puig
Figure skating's Elvis Stojko
Soccer's Cristiano Ronaldo
Cricket's Imran Khan
That was simply this awe-inspiring adjective often paired with "the ridiculous"
This title for Christian ministers such as Ike is also an adjective meaning "deserving respect"
As part of my sense of awe, I feel this 5-letter synonym for deep fear
I kneel before this Broadway theatre where "The Phantom of the Opera" has been playing since 1988
The Latin mirabilis gave us this word for something awesome or what we do "at" it

rounds.comments: (Alex: The author's name is anagrammed in the clue.)

clues.text:
A "miserable(s)" author:
TOUCH VIGOR

Far from the "Twilight" of her career:
EERIEST MEN HYPE

Oh, the courtroom drama:
HORNS JAG HIM

A bit of Danish in Africa:
I SNEAKED SIN

Rely on this American poet:
PERSON WHOM ALL READ
This late funnyman, ever in search of respect: "I met the Surgeon General.  He offered me a cigarette"
By George, this standup comic said, "As soon as someone is identified as an unsung hero, he no longer is"
Jack Handey: "Blow ye winds, like" this Miles Davis instrument "blows, but without that noise"
For "Blazing Saddles", this legendary black standup wrote the classic line "Mongo only pawn in game of life"
This extremely deadpan comic asked, "What's another word for thesaurus?"
These 2 men clash in 1 Samuel 17 in a game of rock, sword, spear; rock beats sword & spear
These 2 classic Monopoly properties are available for a combined price of $750
Though linked today, the 2 men behind A&F, this clothing company, were working partners only from 1900 to 1907
In "Through the Looking-Glass", these "fat little men only looked at each other and grinned", not good for much else
In 1877 these 2 moons of Mars got their names from words denoting fear & terror
The colorful title of this Antarctic graphic novel from Greg Rucka refers to a visibility condition created by a snowstorm
32 years after "A Wrinkle in Time", she wrote of the South Pole in "Troubling a Star"
Clive Cussler's "Atlantis Found" finds this protagonist--no relation to Brad--in Antarctica
Beryl Bainbridge's "Birthday Boys" fetes this explorer's fatal 1912 expedition to the South Pole
In John Campbell's novella "Who Goes There?", filmed with this title, an alien ship is found in Antarctica
Popes taking office in 575, 855 & 2005 used this name
Latin was made the church language by a pope of this name, Latin for winner or conqueror
A 20th century pope took this name to honor the popes who made him a bishop & a cardinal
The last pope with this name from Latin for "good-doer" died in 1404
Reigning from 1471 to 1484, the fourth pope of this name had a certain chapel built
The objective case of I
Sir, you don't look 18; I'll need to see this
A conjunction
For Ice Cube it was a good day because "I didn't even have to use" this weapon
William James Mayo got his in 1883
This duo "Escape from Guantanamo Bay"
This film "II: The Legend of Curly's Gold"
This comedy "2 1/2: The Smell of Fear"
2013's "A Good Day to" do this
"28 Weeks Later" is a sequel to this film
